@ Kamil91

En "DVD5" är en "vanlig" dvd skiva med 4,7 GB utrymme.
En "DVD9" är en så kallad "Dual Layer" dvd skiva med 8,5 GB.
Det är alltså två lager med data istället för ett.
DVD9 Recordable dvd:er finns inte tillgängliga att köpa ännu.
Men både Philips Research och Pioneer har sagt att dom är på gång att göra det tillgängligt på marknaden

Or if you´re using Windows, Check the "Recycle Bin" if they are still in there.

I use the M8 BIOS. but if you have an Xecuter2 chip, the x2 bios is what you should use i guess.
Hey, 4X. From what i have been told (and from personal experience)
You should never burn faster than 1X, even though the discs a capable of doing so.
Even though it takes longer, it is better for the discs and they last longer.
Even though most games may work, the xbox´s dvd drive i quite picky with discs.
And when you burn them faster they wear more on the laser, resulting in the deterioration of the laser.

Try burning it slower.. 
But hey, did you manage to unrar it without errors??

Something must have gotten fucked while you were downloading, for sure.
Just check the SFV, if anything is wrong with the DL it should be noticed. Otherwise there could be thousands of other reasons, DVD-media, DVD-burner, DVD_player in xbox etc...

Rytty - the reason why you are getting that error is because you are running a FAT 32 file system and you need to be running the NTFS file system, FAT32 doesnt do more than so many gigs, sorry to say but you will have to change your file system!  Elaine
